file_content.text: Section X used to run like clockwork. Now this....
The doctors gave me a clean bill of health, Major. The healthiest mind they'd ever seen.
Give our new allies the rundown. Secure Section X. That is all.
Wonderful, you're here! It's chaos out there, Master Jedi. Pure chaos!
Major Endran, sir. I've been told you outrank me here. To avoid confusion.
Perfect timing, Captain. We've got a real mess on our hands.
Finally! Major Endran, at your service. Just been prepped for your arrival.
General Conlath's nervous breakdown came at the worst time. One second, we're battling the Empire; the next, we're staring down the Dread Masters' lieutenants.
No idea what these Dread Guards are hunting for. But they've released an army of the Dread Masters' monstrous servants to help!
This prison still holds many horrible secrets. If the Dread Masters claim even one of them, losing Belsavis may be the least of our concerns.
Their hunt cannot succeed.
I don't even want to think about it, Master Jedi.
If the Empire supported the Dread Masters, they'd have landed an army of soldiers to aid their hunt. We may be facing a rogue Sith operation.
The Sith must act alone.
Explains why the Dread Guards kill everyone they see. Imp, Republic, doesn't matter.
Neutralize the Dread Guards, dishearten their legion, and we'll break the back of their offensive.
Armies I can handle.
Can't wait to see Havoc Squad back in action, Major.
Unless the Dread Masters lost the keys to their dreadnaught, I'd say they're looking to make a giant score.
They're after something big.
Whatever they're after, let's hope we never see it.
What Dread Guards?
Dread Guards?
The Dread Masters' foul captains. I've seen one kill ten Jedi without breaking a sweat.
Control yourself, Major. Or you'll be sent for psych evaluation with your general.
Calm down.
Relax, already. Everyone gets so freaked out around these Dread Masters.
Take it easy.
You're right. Need to keep my head. It's that or die.
Lucky for us, the Imps aren't on good terms with the Dread Masters' thralls. We're looking at a three-army showdown in Section X.
Keep your head down, and check our battle notices. It's the only way we're stopping the Dread Masters.
If you see a Dread Guard, run.
